Description: Fragment of rim and cul of large Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalic; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of faded lotus flower in added white outline with added red centre above two white bands; exterior: narrow black line at top of rim; below, painted decoration consisting of bull (hindquarters, body and part of foreleg remaining) to right; elaborate rosette as filling ornament; below two brown lines; on cul, part of guilloche pattern.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the pattern on the bull's body, see Lemos no. 236, from Vulci (one of the two Würzburg chalices).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0525) (phase 2)
